alert.note: Alert for Lenawee; Monroe; Washtenaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 1:01AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Monroe, northern Lenawee and Washtenaw Counties through 200 AM EDT... At 101 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pinckney to Grass Lake to 9 miles southwest of Vandercook Lake. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Chelsea around 105 AM EDT. Dexter and Cement City around 110 AM EDT. Manchester and Addison around 115 AM EDT. Ann Arbor around 120 AM EDT. Adrian, Ypsilanti, Saline and Tecumseh around 125 AM EDT. Britton around 130 AM EDT. Milan and Willis around 135 AM EDT. Dundee, Petersburg and Deerfield around 140 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Manitou Beach-Devils Lake, Pittsfield Township, Cone, Whittaker, Macon, Hudson Mills Metropark, Bridgewater, Ridgeway, Delhi Mills and Pleasant Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
